page.title: 17United Reform Church, Dunmow
page.content: At the United Reform Church we found that wine represents Jesus' blood and bread represents his body. People preach from the pulpit. The choir comes in and one of the elders puts the Bible on the stand and then they sing hymns, say prayers and have a sermon. There are no statues in the church, and on the air pump of the organ there are lots of carvings of names but there are no bells or coloured windows like other churches. There is a balcony with many extra seats but this has been blocked off since fewer people attend now and this saves heat in Winter. The church has many social meetings and runs a Sunday school. There are about 60 members at present.
